p: After some initial optimism, suggesting the potential usefulness of ACE-inhibitors and/or AT 1R inhibitors to build protection against severe lung damage (Weiss and Leibowitz 2011), recent experimental findings have raised some doubts (Ferrario et al. 2005) or cautioned against its use as prophylactic medication (Sommerstein 2020). Given the increased vulnerability of patients with age and the widespread use of ACE-inhibitors, more research into the epidemiological relation between the use of ACE-inhibitors and 2019-nCoV-related ARDS is needed. To our opinion, this should become prioritized in global public health research related to COVID-19.
